info.title: Customer Management
info.description: This is Swagger UI environment generated for the TMF Customer Management specification

get.description: This operation list or find Customer entities

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Comma-separated properties to be provided in response

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Requested index for start of resources to be provided in response

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Requested number of resources to be provided in response

X-Result-Count.description: Actual number of items returned in the response body

X-Total-Count.description: Total number of items matching criteria

post.description: This operation creates a Customer entity.

get.summary: Retrieves a Customer History by Customer Id
get.description: This operation retrieves a CustomerHistory entity.
This operation retrieves a Customer entity. Attribute selection is enabled for all first level attributes.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Comma-separated properties to provide in response

patch.description: This operation updates partially a Customer entity.

delete.description: This operation deletes a Customer entity.

post.description: Sets the communication endpoint address the service instance must use to deliver information about its health state, execution state, failures and metrics.

parameters.name: data
parameters.description: Data containing the callback endpoint to deliver the information

delete.description: Resets the communication endpoint address the service instance must use to deliver information about its health state, execution state, failures and metrics.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the registered listener

post.description: Example of a client listener for receiving the notification CustomerCreateEvent

Example of a client listener for receiving the notification CustomerStateChangeEvent
Example of a client listener for receiving the notification CustomerDeleteEvent

user.description: User who made the changes on Customer

changeDate.description: Date time of the change, using IETC-RFC-3339 format

snapshot.description: Snapshot of customer object after changes

AccountRef.description: Account reference. A account may be a party account or a financial account.

@baseType.description: When sub-classing, this defines the super-class

@type.description: When sub-classing, this defines the sub-class entity name

@referredType.description: The actual type of the target instance when needed for disambiguation.

AgreementRef.description: Agreement reference. An agreement represents a contract or arrangement, either written or verbal and sometimes enforceable by law, such as a service level agreement or a customer price agreement. An agreement involves a number of other business entities, such as products, services, and resources and/or their specifications.

id.description: Unique identifier of a related entity.

AttachmentRefOrValue.description: An attachment by value or by reference. An attachment complements the description of an element, for example through a document, a video, a picture.

id.description: Unique identifier for this particular attachment

attachmentType.description: Attachment type such as video, picture

content.description: The actual contents of the attachment object, if embedded, encoded as base64

description.description: A narrative text describing the content of the attachment

mimeType.description: Attachment mime type such as extension file for video, picture and document

url.description: Uniform Resource Locator, is a web page address (a subset of URI)

validFor.description: The period of time for which the attachment is valid

Characteristic.description: Describes a given characteristic of an object or entity through a name/value pair.

valueType.description: Data type of the value of the characteristic

@baseType.description: When sub-classing, this defines the super-class

@schemaLocation.description: A URI to a JSON-Schema file that defines additional attributes and relationships

@type.description: When sub-classing, this defines the sub-class entity name

ContactMedium.description: Indicates the contact medium that could be used to contact the party.

mediumType.description: Type of the contact medium, such as: email address, telephone number, postal address

preferred.description: If true, indicates that is the preferred contact medium

characteristic.description: Any additional characteristic(s) of this contact medium

validFor.description: The time period that the contact medium is valid for

@baseType.description: When sub-classing, this defines the super-class

@schemaLocation.description: A URI to a JSON-Schema file that defines additional attributes and relationships

@type.description: When sub-classing, this defines the sub-class entity name

CreditProfile.description: Credit profile for the party (containing credit scoring, ...). By default only the current credit profile  is retrieved. It can be used as a list to give the party credit profiles history, the first one in the list will be the current one.

creditProfileDate.description: The date the profile was established

creditRiskRating.description: This is an integer whose value is used to rate the risk

creditScore.description: A measure of a person or organizations creditworthiness calculated on the basis of a combination of factors such as their income and credit history

validFor.description: The period for which the profile is valid

@baseType.description: When sub-classing, this defines the super-class

@schemaLocation.description: A URI to a JSON-Schema file that defines additional attributes and relationships

@type.description: When sub-classing, this defines the sub-class entity name

href.description: Url used to reference the customer.

name.description: A word, term, or phrase by which the Customer is known and distinguished from other Customers.

status.description: Used to track the lifecycle status of the customer.

statusReason.description: A string providing an explanation on the value of the status lifecycle. For instance if the status is Rejected, statusReason will provide the reason for rejection.

characteristic.description: Describes the characteristic of a customer.

engagedParty.description: The party - an organization or an individual - that is engaged as a customer.

validFor.description: The time period that the Customer is valid for.

@baseType.description: When sub-classing, this defines the super-class

MediumCharacteristic.description: Describes the contact medium characteristics that could be used to contact a party (an individual or an organization)

contactType.description: The type of contact, for example: phone number such as mobile, fixed home, fixed office. postal address such as shipping instalationâ€¦

emailAddress.description: Full email address in standard format

faxNumber.description: The fax number of the contact

phoneNumber.description: The primary phone number of the contact

socialNetworkId.description: Identifier as a member of a social network

town.description: The town. A town is a compactly settled area usually larger than a village but smaller than a city (Turkey: Ilce) e.g. Pendik

locality.description: Neighborhood, village or other locality. e.g. Gencosman Mah.

buildingNumber.description: The street number of the building. e.g. 25

unitNumber.description: Number of the interior unit within a building, such as a flat, apartment or office number. e.g. Daire:8

PaymentMethodRef.description: PaymentMethod reference. A payment method defines a specific mean of payment (e.g direct debit).

id.description: Unique identifier of the payment mean

Quantity.description: An amount in a given unit

amount.description: Numeric value in a given unit

RelatedParty.description: Related Entity reference. A related party defines party or party role linked to a specific entity.

id.description: Unique identifier of a related entity.

role.description: Role played by the related party

RelatedPlaceRef.description: Related Entity reference. A related place defines a place described by reference or by value linked to a specific entity. The polymorphic attributes @type, @schemaLocation & @referredType are related to the place entity and not the RelatedPlaceRef class itself

PartyRef.description: Party reference. A party ref defines the real world party (organization or individual) linked to a specific entity (such as a customer or a party role entity).

TimePeriod.description: A period of time, either as a deadline (endDateTime only) a startDateTime only, or both

endDateTime.description: End of the time period, using IETC-RFC-3339 format

startDateTime.description: Start of the time period, using IETC-RFC-3339 format. If you define a start, you must also define an end

Error.description: Used when an API throws an Error, typically with a HTTP error response-code (3xx, 4xx, 5xx)

code.description: Application relevant detail, defined in the API or a common list.

reason.description: Explanation of the reason for the error which can be shown to a client user.

message.description: More details and corrective actions related to the error which can be shown to a client user.

referenceError.description: URI of documentation describing the error.
